titles.title: Nebraska National Forest Cooperation Act of 2002

To authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to enter into cooperative agreements and contracts with the Nebraska State Forester to carry out watershed restoration and protection activities on National Forest System land in the State of Nebraska.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Resources, and in addition to the Committee on Agriculture, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition and Forestry.

committee.subcommittee: Department Operations, Oversight, Nutrition, and Forestry
committee.name: House Agriculture

bill.summary: 7/24/2002--Introduced. Nebraska National Forest Cooperation Act of 2002 - Authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to enter into cooperative agreements and contracts with the Nebraska State Forester for watershed restoration and protection activities on National Forest System land in Nebraska if the State Forester is carrying out similar activities on adjacent State or private land.Includes among such activities: (1) treatment of insect-infested trees; (2) reduction of hazardous fuels; and (3) improvement of watersheds across ownership boundaries.Terminates agreement and contract authority on September 30, 2006.
